sentences.english: He keeps his own nature shelf on the windowsill.
sentences.chinese: 他的窗臺也有自然一角。

sentences.english: Caption : BEIJING, CHINA - A daily moment of hutong named:weijia, during the early winter in beijing. a homeless cat on a window.
sentences.chinese: 北京初冬時節衚衕裏日常生活，一隻流浪貓在窗臺上。

sentences.english: But this year I choose on the windowsill, obtained a leisurely.
sentences.chinese: 但今年我卻選擇獨倚窗臺，求得一點閒適。

sentences.english: She painted the window sills a bright colour.
sentences.chinese: 她把窗臺漆上鮮豔的顏色。

sentences.english: Then they put this"Jack-o-lantern"in their window.
sentences.chinese: 然後，他們將這“南瓜鬼臉燈”放在他們的窗臺上。

sentences.english: There is porcelain vase of blue on windowsill , inserting Huang Yanyan's chrysanthemum.
sentences.chinese: 窗臺上有着藍色的瓷花瓶，插着黃豔豔的菊花。

sentences.english: Wash floors, windowsills, hands, toys, and pacifiers often.
sentences.chinese: 清洗地板，窗臺邊，雙手，玩具，奶嘴常。

sentences.english: A hungry little robin hopped onto the windowsill.
sentences.chinese: 一隻飢餓的小知更鳥跳到窗臺上。

sentences.english: It was if Hannah had taken her turn and put the menorah in your window for me to see.
sentences.chinese: 就彷彿是漢娜將聖燭臺放在你的窗臺上讓我看到一樣。

sentences.english: I saw that menorah in your window and I started to cry.
sentences.chinese: 我看到了在你窗臺上那個燭臺，馬上就哭了。

sentences.english: Bright sunflowers are smiling to the passers-by from the high windowsill.
sentences.chinese: 明媚的太陽花從高高的窗臺上向行人微笑。

sentences.english: When I lie on the sills , so many cars and trucks run along the road .
sentences.chinese: 當我靠在窗臺邊，如此多的汽車正駛過馬路。

sentences.english: It was myself, I love to visible in the window, looked at the blue sky.
sentences.chinese: 那是的我，總愛趴在窗臺上，望着那藍藍的天空。

sentences.english: Carry stones up into the houses; line the windowsills and the roofs with them.
sentences.chinese: 把鋪路石搬進樓房，沿着窗臺和閣樓的窗戶排齊。

sentences.english: Bright sunflowers are smiling to the passerss-by from the high windowsill.
sentences.chinese: 明媚的太陽花從高高的窗臺了向行人微笑。

sentences.english: Lots of dead insects lie on the windowsill.
sentences.chinese: 各種各樣的昆蟲屍體裝點着窗臺。

definition: to lean unsteadily from side to side (idiom)/to sway/(of buildings etc) to lean at a crazy angle
balcony/patio/flat roof/terrace/deck (unroofed platform)/outdoor stage/ancient imperial celestial observation terrace
